DOC.brief_summary: Drug eluting stents significantly reduced the rate of in-stent restenosis in coronary arteries. There are several kinds of DES i.e. eluting the drug either from stable or biodegradable polymer. The type of the polymer may impact the clinical outcome. The aim of our study was to compare safety and efficacy of implantation of two different types of stents eluting paclitaxel from stable vs biodegradable polymer (TAXUS stent vs LUC-CHOPIN stent) into coronary artery by-pass graft.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Safety and Efficacy of Two Different Drug Eluting Stents Implanted Into Saphenous Vein Grafts
DOC.criteria: 1. Atherosclerotic lesion in saphenous vein grafts causing angiographic stenosis â‰¥70% 2. Stable coronary artery disease or non ST segment elevation acute coronary syndrome 3. Reference segment diameter in range of 2.54.5mm 1. Cardiogenic shock 2. Contraindications to prolonged dual antiplatelet therapy 3. Female of child birth potential unless on effective contraception 4. Other medical condition that may limit survival
DOC.keyword: saphenous vein graft, TAXUS stent, Chopin stent
